intro: Cytinus sanguineus, commonly known as the blood-red broom or the red broom, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a hemiparasitic plant, meaning it partially depends on other plants for water and nutrients through its specialized roots. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats. Its unique appearance and parasitic nature make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
